result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrell Antwain Kelly is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Terrell Antwain Kelly was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  To be paid from up to 25% of any monetary amounts pursuant to Wisc Stats 973.05(4)(b), 303.04(8), 973.20 and as a condition of extended supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

07-21-2017/ Judge M Joseph Donald                   
Upon stipulation by the parties, Court grants motion and modified the JOC to add  an "ADDITIONAL" 130 days of sentence credit for time served.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violent contact with Lajennia J.
No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.

Pursuant to 973.048, defendant to comply with the reporting requirements under 301.45 for the sex offender registry with DOC. 
Court ordered a sex ofender assessment.  Follow through with recommended programming.  Cannot have employment/volunteer where he will supervise or work with children under 16 years of age.
Participate in cognitive intervention, vocational training and parenting classes.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment. Follow through with recommended programming

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Per Order Dated November 10, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP1584-CR, IT IS ORDERED that within thirty days of the date of this order, counsel for Kelly shall make arrangements to have the circuit court enter an order memorializing its oral ruling on that portion of Kelly's motion seeking sentence modification. Counsel for Kelly shall ensure the order is filed with the circuit court clerk. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for the circuit court to decide Kelly's postconviction motion is extended to within thirty days of the date of this order. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that within fourteen days of the date on which the order disposing of Kelly's request for sentence modification is filed with the circuit court clerk, the clerk of the circuit court shall transmit, by supplemental return, the written order described herein and the transcript of the July 21, 2017 motion hearing, which was filed on September 18, 2017. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the appellant's brief and appendix shall be due within fourteen days of the date on which the record supplement is filed in this court.

Denying Motion to Vacate Conviction; signed and filed.

Defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly in court with attorney Pamela Moorshead.  Defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for arguments and decision on Defendant's postconviction motion to vacate the conviction and withdraw the plea.

Closing arguments as to the Machner Hearing heard.
COURT'S RULING:  Defense motion to to vacate the conviction and withdraw the plea is DENIED.  Court adopts State's "proposed" Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law.

AS TO DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE:  Arguments heard.  Court DENIED motion.

AS TO DEFENDANT'S MOTION TO MODIFY THE JUDGMENT OF CONVICTION FOR ADDITIONAL CREDIT DAYS:  Upon stipulation of the parties, Court GRANTS motion and MODIFIED the Judgment of Conviction to add an "additional" 130 days credit for time served.

Court signed State's "Proposed" Decision and Order Denying Motion to Vacate Conviction on today's date.

re: sentencing, received and filed.

Defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  Additional statements by:  Lajennia J., Eula H. and Brenda K. 
The Court imposes the following Bifurcated Sentence:
Defendant's TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE shall be for 18 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant's TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin Prison System shall be for 10 YEARS with credit for 200 days time served.  Defendant shall serve 8 YEARS on EXTENDED SUPERVISION.  Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  The Court advised the defendant of his determinate sentence pursuant to statute and in accordance with Form 1910 R1.
The Court ordered that all appropriate costs, surcharges and special assessments be paid from up to 25% of any monetary amounts pursuant to Wis. Stats. 973.05(4)(b), 303.04(8), 973.20 and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
-  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
-  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
-  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Witness LaJeania Jackson present in court.  Attorney Josh Mathy for the state of Wisconsin.  
Arguments heard as to body attachment and bail.  Court vacated the body attachment and order a signature bond of $1000.  Court ordered the following conditions of bail:  comply with the DA's office and V/W services, update the DA's office of change of addresses and/or phone number, return all calls from the DA's office within 24 HOURS, contact the DA's office the 1st of every month until this matter is resolved and at least leave a message for V/W, and have no contact with the defendant.

Defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Defendant Terrell Antwain Kelly in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Discussion regarding plea negotiations.  
  Defendant sworn in. 
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting and Child sex offender working with children.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Case adjourned to Branch 12.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-23-2014 at 03:00 pm.
